item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Philip Larkin
item.description: "What will survive of us is love." -- Philip Larkin

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Philip Larkin
item.description: "Home is so sad. It stays as it was left, / Shaped to the comfort of the last to go / As if to win them back" -- Philip Larkin

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Philip K. Dick
Krazykiwi add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I am reading six books at once, the only way of reading; since, as you will agree, one book is only a single unaccompanied note, and to get the full sound, one needs ten others at the same time." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by John Crowley
item.description: "Love is a myth.' 'Love is a myth,' Grandfather Trout said. 'Like summer.' 'What?' 'In winter,'Grandfather Trout said, 'summer is a myth. A report, a rumor. Not to be believed in. Get it? Love is a myth. So is summer." -- John Crowley

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by John Ajvide Lindqvist
item.description: "For a few seconds Oskar saw through Eli's eyes. And what he saw was...himself. Only much better, more handsome, stronger than what he thought of himself. Seen with love." (Let the Right One In)" -- John Ajvide Lindqvist

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Henning Mankell
Krazykiwi add a quote by Peter Pohl
item.description: "Ord är min favoriträtt." -- Peter Pohl

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Brian Aldiss
item.description: "When childhood dies, its corpses are called adults." -- Brian Aldiss

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Petronius
item.description: "Can't you see that I'm only advising you to beg yourself not to be so dumb?" -- Petronius

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Otis Y. Chandler
item.description:
"I agree that it's a shame some books have to suffer ratings that clearly are invalid. However I can't think of a way to prevent it, and I didn't see any ideas in the thread either (I did skim though).
I hope you'll appreciate that if we just start deleting ratings whenever we feel like it, that we've gone down a censorship road that doesn't take us to a good place." -- Otis Y. Chandler

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "There are books full of great writing that don't have very good stories. Read sometimes for the story... don't be like the book-snobs who won't do that. Read sometimes for the words--the language. Don't be like the play-it-safers who won't do that. But when you find a book that has both a good story and good words, treasure that book." -- Stephen King

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Daniel Pennac
item.description:
"Reader's Bill of Rights
1. The right to not read
2. The right to skip pages
3. The right to not finish
4. The right to reread
5. The right to read anything
6. The right to escapism
7. The right to read anywhere
8. The right to browse
9. The right to read out loud
10. The right to not defend your tastes" -- Daniel Pennac

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Daniel Pennac
item.description: "Time spent reading, like time spent loving, increases our lifetime. " -- Daniel Pennac

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Longed for him. Got him. Shit." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Richard Fortey
item.description: "A life accumulates a collection: of people, work and perplexities. We are all our own curators. " -- Richard Fortey

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Richard Fortey
item.description: "My contract had specified only that I 'should undertake work upon the fossil Arthropoda,' which left me free to roam through hundreds of millions of years. It might as well have said: 'Amuse yourself--for money." -- Richard Fortey

item.title: Krazykiwi add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "Books are no more threatened by Kindle than stairs by elevators." -- Stephen Fry
